Award.AwardTitle: Workshop on Compound Semiconductor Materials & Devices (WOCSEMMAD) February 16-19, 2015, The Wild Dunes, Isle of Palms, South Carolina (near Charleston)

Division.LongName: Div Of Electrical, Commun & Cyber Sys

Award.AbstractNarration: The 2015 Workshop on Compound Semiconductor Materials & Devices (WOCSEMMAD) will address research areas in III-V compound semiconductor field. SiC and GaN device concepts for high power switches and demonstration of high power switching capability with superior properties, as well as new processing and materials possibilities will be major areas on which the Workshop will focus. It is one of the few workshop format meetings where the latest results can be debated and discussed in a relatively open format. WOCSEMMAD has played a key role in identifying new directions for research. The workshop will be held February 16-19, 2015 at Wild Dunes, Isle of Palms, South Carolina and the project will support student participation. WOCSEMMAD's broader impact will be on the design and development of novel new devices and materials. Along with these new materials and devices, new industries and jobs will be created with lasting impact on science and economy.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The project aimed at supporting travel and participation expenses for graduate students to attend and present their work at the Workshop on Compound Semiconductor Materials and Devices (WOCSEMMAD), that was held in Wild Dunes, Isle of Palms SC, from February 16 through February 19 of 2015. WOCSEMMAD is one of the oldest and most prestigious workshops in the field of science and technology of compound semiconductors materials and devices and where each year some of the most renowned experts in field are invited to present their latest R&D breakthroughs. As a part of the outreach component of the workshop, each year a limited number of exceptionally talented graduate students are also selected by the organizing committee to present their work at the workshop. It should be noted that many of the senior participants of the workshop emanate from the pool of students who attended in prior editions the conference. As a result of this project, in 2015 the organizing committee selected and supported travel and registration expenses for 8 graduate students, from major US science and engineering academic institutions. The selected students were able to attend and present their work at the conference. In addition to providing these students with an opportunity to interact and share their results with experts in the field, the project also contributed to expand their scope of knowledge and to broaden their awareness on the latest developments in the field of compound semiconductor material and devices. Students participating in the program found the experience as being a very valuable one, as attested by their post conference testimonies.
